did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Sergei Aleksandrovich Golovan Papers,
did.abstract: Correspondence, military orders, communiqués, and clippings, relating to the Russian Civil War, and White Russian military relations with Switzerland.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Sergei Aleksandrovich Golovan Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains material from the office of Maj.-Gen. Sergei Golovan, head of the Rossiiskaia Voennaia Agentura v Shveitsarii (Russian Military Agency in Switzerland). It covers the period 1919-1921 and includes correspondence, orders, and operational, political and intelligence reports received from various White Russian offices and officials, including the headquarters of the Vooruzhennyia Sily Iuga Rossii (VSIUR) (Armed Forces of South Russia) and the Voennyi Predstavitel' Verkhovnago Pravitelia pri Soiuznykh Pravitel'stvakh I Soiuznom Verkhovnom Komandovanii (Military Representative of the Supreme Ruler to the Allied Governments and Allied Supreme Command). Most of this material is related to Russian military personnel residing or passing through Switzerland and especially to sick and invalid former prisoners of war in Swiss sanatoria.
Also included are proclamations and other official publications of VSIUR and a collection of clippings from the Russian, Swiss, and British press.
This collection was first arranged by Lieut.-Gen. Nikolai Golovin and the present register fully retains this arrangement, in which the material is divided numerically into files.

did.unittitle: ROSSIISKAIA VOENNAIA AGENTURA V SHVEITSARII, 1919-1920.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence with various White Russian offices and officials, especially the office of Gen. Dmitrii Shcherbachev in Paris and the headquarters of VSIUR (Vooruzhennyia Sily Iuga Rossii), orders, reports, information bulletins, miscellaneous material re military personnel and former Russian prisoners of war residing in Switzerland, bound clippings from Swiss, English, and Russian press. Arranged by file number and therein by physical form

did.unittitle: OVERSIZE FILE, 1919-1920.

scopecontent.p: Proclamations under the signature of Gen. Aleksei Denikin and reports of VSIUR General Staff

did.unittitle: ROSSIISKAIA VOENNAIA AGENTURA V SHVEITSARII, 1919-1920

File 1. Orders and official operational, political, and intelligence reports received by the Rossiiskaia Voennaia Agentura v SHveitsarii from General D. Shcherbachev, Voennyi Predstavitel' Verkhovnago Pravitelia pri Soiuznykh Pravitel'stvakh I Soiuznom Verkhovnom Komandovanii, 1919
Original binding cover describing material included in file
Orders, 1919 September-November
Reports, 1919
Telegrams, 1919 October-November
File 2. Miscellaneous orders received from Voennyi Predstavitel' Glavnokomanduiushchago Russkoi Armii Pri Pravitel'stve Frantsuzskoi Respubliki, 1920
File 3. Printed information bulletins issued by the Omsk Government re military matters and relations with foreign governments, 1919
File 4. News bulletins issued by the Biuro Russkoi Pechati v Konstantinopole, 1921
File 5. Orders and correspondence re recruitment of military personnel for White Armies, 1919-1920
File 6. Russian military personnel in Switzerland, 1919-1920
Original binding cover describing material included in file
Alphabetical listing of resident military personnel
Correspondence re military personnel in Switzerland
File 7. Miscellaneous office correspondence with other Russian military missions, institutions, and organizations, especially re military personnel, 1919
File 8. Same as above, 1919-1920

File 9. Correspondence with General D. Shcherbachev, Lieut.-General Nikolai Monkevich, Glavnoupolnomochennyi Glavnokomanduiushchago Vooruzhennymi Silami Iuga Rossii, and other military missions, mostly re recruitment of military personnel, 1919-1920
File 10
Original binding cover describing material included in file
General. Official orders of VSIUR headquarters and reports of Otdel Propagandy Pri VSIUR
News bulletins, Biuro Russkoi Pechati v Konstantinopole, 1920
File 11. Information reports, bulletins, and official orders issued by VSIUR, 1920
Original binding cover describing material included in file
Reports re situation in Germany received from the Russkaia Delegatsiia po Delam Voennoplennykh I Bezhentsev v Germanii
Summaries of European and Soviet press
File 13. Operations telegrams from the British War Office re situation on Russian fronts, 1920-1921
File 14
Original binding cover describing material included in file
Correspondence with private individuals
Orders issued by VSIUR and other official communications. Includes Bainbridge Colby's note on U.S.-Russian relations

File 15. Correspondence re care in Swiss sanatoria of sick and invalid former Russian prisoners of war and their repatriation and reports re condition, political mood, and Soviet influence on former prisoners of war. Includes correspondence of Société de la Croix-Rouge de Russie, Bureau de Secours aux Prisonniers de Guerre, Section Russe, Berne, 1919-1920

File 16. Operational, political, and intelligence reports received by the Rossiiskaia Voennaia Agentura v SHveitsarii from General D. Shcherbachev, Voennyi Predstavitel' Verkhovnago Pravitelia pri Soiuznykh Pravitel'stvakh I Soiuznom Verkhovnom Komandovanii, 1919
File 17. Same as above, 1919 December-1920 March
File 18. Same as above, 1920 March-September
File 19. Same as above, 1920 September-December
File 20, 1919. See also OVERSIZE FILE
Original binding cover describing material included in file
Orders issued by British commander, Maj.-Gen. H. C. Holman to British Military Mission, South Russia
Reports
Dezhurnyi General Shtaba (military court decisions)
Morskoe Upravlenie VSIUR (complement of ships in the White fleet
Osobaia Kommissiia po Razsledovaniiu Zlodeianii Bol'shevikov, Sostoiashchaia pri Glavnokomanduiushchem VSIUR
File 21. Office of the Rossiiskaia Voennaia Agentura v Shveitsarii. Correspondence
Original binding cover describing material included in file
Russian government agencies
Swiss officials and Allied representatives
File 22. Bound clippings from Swiss, British, and Russian press, 1919
OVERSIZE FILE, 1919-1920.
Proclamations under signature of Lieut.-Gen. Aleksei Denikin
Reports (operational, political, and intelligence) issued by the Shtab Glavnokomanduiushchago VSIUR
General
Leaflets
